definitions.definition: to have sex and produce young

examples.text: Many animals breed only at certain times of the year.

definitions.definition: to keep animals or plants in order to produce young ones for a particular purpose

examples.text: The rabbits are bred for their long coats.
Greyhounds were originally bred as hunting dogs.
the first panda to be bred in captivity
She's a lovely cat. Will you breed from her?
dogs that are bred for their fighting ability
fish that have been selectively bred for their appearance
The otters were bred in captivity and then released into the wild.

definitions.definition: to be the cause of something
to educate somebody in a particular way as they are growing up

examples.text: Fear of failure was bred into him at an early age.

definitions.definition: born and having grown up in a particular place with a particular background and education

examples.text: He was born and bred in Boston.
I'm a Londoner, born and bred.

definitions.definition: to have a lot of babies in a short space of time
knowing somebody/something very well may cause you to lose respect for them/it

wordOrigin: Old English brēdan ‘produce (offspring), bear (a child)’, of Germanic origin; related to German brüten, also to brood.
